intro: Scabiosa baetica, commonly known as the Spanish scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often erect and branching. Scabiosa baetica is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
